thread.title: Mino Raiola refuses to confirm Zlatan Ibrahimovic will remain at Manchester United next season
thread.title_full: Mino Raiola refuses to confirm Zlatan Ibrahimovic will remain at Manchester United next season

author: David Anderson
title: Mino Raiola refuses to confirm Zlatan Ibrahimovic will remain at Manchester United next season
text:
Sport Mino Raiola refuses to confirm Zlatan Ibrahimovic will remain at Manchester United next season Ibrahimovic signed a one-year deal to join United last summer and has bagged 26 goals in his debut campaign Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Zlatan Ibrahimovic hails Manchester United's EFL Cup win Share this video Get Manchester United FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Zlatan Ibrahimovic's agent Mino Raiola has added to the uncertainty over the striker's Manchester United future by claiming "anything could happen" 
Mirror Sport has revealed that Ibrahimovic is refusing to commit his future to United because he is worried about the club missing out on the Champions League again. 
And Raiola has fuelled United's concerns by refusing to offer any encouragement that he will accept the club's offer to sign on for next season. 
Ibrahimovic, 35, scored twice to help United beat Southampton in Sunday's EFL Cup Final and Raiola hinted that all options remain open to the Swede. Ibrahimovic celebrates his second goal of the game (Photo: Getty) The difference maker at Wembley (Photo: Rex Features) Raiola has added to the uncertainty (Photo: AFP via Getty) Read More Is Zlatan Ibrahimovic the greatest ever free transfer? We asked our reporters 
"I don't exclude anything," he told TalkSPORT. "Anything can happen and we will see what happens. 
"We're now concentrated on the next cup. This was a very important cup and very emotional for him, for me and for Mourinho too. 
"So let's just try to give the fans some more cups. 
"I never speak about contract details with the press. I think that's something between the player, the club and myself. 
"I think we should keep it that way and just enjoy the moment and we'll see what happens next year."
